info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 12:01AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rutherford, southeastern Transylvania, southeastern Henderson, Polk, southwestern Cleveland, northern Greenville, northwestern Spartanburg, north central Anderson, northwestern Cherokee, Pickens and northeastern Oconee Counties through 1245 AM EST... At 1201 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Columbus to 4 miles north of Walhalla. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Easley, Pickens, Columbus, Walhalla, Shelby, West Greenville, Greer, Taylors and Berea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for western North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
